data.title: Fleet Mechanic: Tractor/Trailer - Council Bluffs, IA
data.meta_description: FCC is always looking for success-driven individuals with strong and well-rounded backgrounds in the transportation industry. Join us for a secure future.
data.text:
Fremont Contract Carriers, a premier truckload transportation and logistics company, has an immediate opening for a Tractor/Trailer Fleet Mechanic in our Council Bluffs, IA Maintenance facilities. We are looking for motivated and success-driven individuals with strong, well-rounded backgrounds in the transportation industry. Position requires exceptional communication and problem-solving skills in a fast-paced, challenging environment.

FCC has been in business for over 50 years and has developed a reputation as a strong industry leader in providing high quality, award-winning transportation services to our customers. FCC operates 400 trucks, 1000 high-cubed dry vans and 100 flatbed, curtain-side and step deck trailers.

Position Summary:

The primary function of this position includes, but is not limited to, performing the maintenance, service, and related repairs of FCC tractor and trailer equipment and any related mechanical components as directed by the shift supervisor.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Perform service, maintenance and repair of all FCC company tractor and trailer equipment as assigned.

Perform diagnostics and repairs of the tractor fleet to include but not limited to; engines, transmissions, brake systems, ABS, electronic components, air systems, APU units, air conditioning/heating systems, and tractor body parts.

Perform preventative maintenance to comply with DOT regulations.

Perform quarterly inspections on fleet tractors and independent contractor equipment.

Perform installation and/or de-installation of Qualcomm communication equipment on fleet tractors and independent contractor equipment.

Perform diagnostics, maintenance, and repairs of the Qualcomm communication equipment.

Perform tractor inspections to prepare tractor for next driver.

Drive trucks in and out of shop before and after repairs.

Operate all equipment in a safe manner in compliance with established safety standards.

Maintain a clean, safe work area free of clutter and in compliance with established safety standards.

Accurately perform required documentation of equipment scheduled for inspection and repair in a timely fashion.

Perform de-identifying of equipment as assigned.

Perform general maintenance and clean up of the buildings and grounds to include: yard work, shop cleaning, trash pickup, sweeping, snow removal, etc.

Maintain regular and predictable attendance.

Will be required to perform other duties and special projects as requested, directed or assigned by management.

Qualifications and/or Experience:

Associate’s degree (A.A.) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school; or

Two years of mechanical related experience in the transportation, heavy equipment or automotive industry; or, equivalent combination of education or experience.

Certificates and Training Requirements:

Valid Driver’s License

Commercial Driver’s License (CDL-A) preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong time management and organizational skills with attention to detail.

Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both oral and written.

General knowledge and proficient use of a computer and computer programs is required for completion of shop work orders and recordkeeping.

Ability to interact effectively, and courteously with drivers and other employees

Ability to work as a part of a team.

Ability to read and understand repair manuals.

Strong mechanical aptitude and problem-solving skills.

Welding skills are a plus.

Other:

Uniforms are provided.

Must provide advanced set of hand tools,(wrenches, sockets, ratchets, etc.), and a rollaway toolbox.

Safety glasses are required.

Safety shoes are required. (Steel toe is optional)

Working Conditions and Environment:

The nature of the environment is one in which the employee may come in contact with outside weather conditions, vibrations, moving mechanical parts, fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, extreme cold or extreme heat and excessive noise.

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand for extended periods of time, walk, talk and hear. Employee will frequently perform bending, crouching, kneeling, climbing, working with their hands, and reaching and grabbing with hands and arms.

Position is physically demanding and tasks performed are repetitive in nature.

Ability to lift and/or move up to 100 pounds as required.

FCC offers:

State of the Art Facilities

Great Work Environment

Competitive Pay Package based on Experience

Full Benefits Package to include:

Paid Vacation, Holiday

Health, Dental, Vision, Life and Voluntary Insurance

401(k) and Profit Sharing

Day and Evening shifts are available, Monday through Friday.

Please either apply online thru the form below, send resume to hr@fcc-inc.com, or call 866-508-2058.

Equal Employment Opportunity

It is the policy of Fremont Contract Carriers, Inc. to afford an equal employment opportunity to all employees, applicants for employment and contractors without regard to age, race, religion, creed, color, sex, national origin, marital status, or pregnancy, and to afford equal opportunities to disabled veterans, veterans of the Vietnam era, and individuals with a disability, and any other prohibited basis of discrimination, as protected under applicable Federal, State or Local law.

Tobacco Free Campus Policy

The use of tobacco products of any kind is prohibited at all times on the Fremont Contract Carriers property, grounds, buildings, and vehicles. Infractions of this policy may constitute grounds for termination.

Drug-Free Workplace Policy

1. Fremont Contract Carriers, Inc. will not consider individuals for employment who use unauthorized or illegal drugs.

2. It is Fremont Contract Carriers intent to maintain a drug/alcohol-free workplace for all employees. As a condition of employment, you will be required to pass a post-offer, pre-placement physical which includes drug/alcohol testing.

3. Fremont Contract Carriers shall maintain the right to require, as a condition of continued employment, drug/alcohol screening of all employees for conditions which may affect the health, safety, and well-being of Fremont Contract Carriers employees. Fremont Contract Carriers current screening requirements include post-incident screening, and reasonable suspicion screening. Fremont Contract Carriers reserves the right to modify this policy.

4. Failure to comply may constitute grounds for immediate termination or rejection from consideration for employment.

Immigration Reform and Control Act

Any offer of employment, if made, will be conditioned upon your immediate production of documentation to prove your identity and employment eligibility status under the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986.
